brief_summary.textblock:
The primary hypothesis to be tested is:

      Detection of breast cancer will be increased with tomosynthesis (3D) imaging.

clinical_study.brief_title: Breast Cancer Detection: Comparison of Breast Tomosynthesis and Conventional Mammography

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Female

          -  Any ethnic origin

          -  No contraindication for routine bilateral mammography

        Exclusion Criteria:

        Potential subjects with any of the following will not be enrolled in the study:

          -  Any contraindications to mammographic screening, including, but not limited to:

          -  Significant existing breast trauma

          -  Under the age of 30 at the time of consent

          -  Breast Implants

          -  Prior Surgeries

               -  Unable to understand and execute written informed consent

               -  Pregnant

               -  Lactating

intervention.description: The mean glandular radiation dose for each image will be approximately 145 millirads (mrad) for a standard size breast (4.2 cm compressed breast thickness).

clinical_study.official_title: Breast Cancer Detection: Comparison of Breast Tomosynthesis and Conventional Mammography

primary_outcome.description: image quality with standard mammography vs tomosynthesis
primary_outcome.time_frame: concurrent assessment of image quality with up to two year follow up for development of breast cancer

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
